xxl.core.util

Class Strings

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.util.Strings

  • public class Strings
extends Object
    This class provides some useful methods for dealing with Strings and parsing Strings.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Function<Object,String> TO_STRING_FUNCTION
      Function which gets an object and returns the String representation of the object (uses toString() inside).

    • Method Summary

      Returns a Predicate which returns true iff the object is inside the array.

      Returns a Function which expects a String parameter s and returns prefix+s+suffix as a String.

      Returns a character reader based reader upon the source given by the name.

      Returns a Predicate which returns true iff the object matches the String which is given.

      This method is parsing a String using the given delimeter and is returning the parsed String as String[] separated by the delimeter.

      This method is parsing a String using given delimeters and is returning the parsed String as String[] separated by the delimeters.

      Assumes that the given String represents a fully qualified file name (i.e., with path information) and returns the file name without any folder information by pruning all parts before the last separator character return the file name itself

    • Method Detail

      • getStringMatchingPredicate

        public static Predicate<String> getStringMatchingPredicate(String matcher)
        Returns a Predicate which returns true iff the object matches the String which is given.
        Parameters:
        matcher - Regular expression.
        Returns:
        The Predicate.
        See Also:
        String.matches(String)

      • getIsInArrayPredicate

        public static Predicate<Object> getIsInArrayPredicate(Object[] array)
        Returns a Predicate which returns true iff the object is inside the array. The internal implementation puts the array into a HashSet for better performance.
        Parameters:
        array - The Objects.
        Returns:
        The Predicate.

      • getPrefixSuffixMapStringFunction

        public static Function<String,String> getPrefixSuffixMapStringFunction(String prefix,
                                                                       String suffix)
        Returns a Function which expects a String parameter s and returns prefix+s+suffix as a String.
        Parameters:
        prefix - Prefix String.
        suffix - Suffix String.
        Returns:
        The Function.

      • parse

        public static String[] parse(String s,
                             String[] delims)
        This method is parsing a String using given delimeters and is returning the parsed String as String[] separated by the delimeters. The delimeters are not returned.
        Parameters:
        s - String to parse
        delims - String[] used as delimeters
        Returns:
        String[] containing the parsed String

      • parse

        public static String[] parse(String s,
                             String delim)
        This method is parsing a String using the given delimeter and is returning the parsed String as String[] separated by the delimeter. The delimeter is not returned.
        Parameters:
        s - String to parse
        delim - String used as delimeter
        Returns:
        String[] containing the parsed String

      • toDoubleArray

        public static double[] toDoubleArray(String[] s)
        This method is converting a String [] to a double [] of same length.
        Parameters:
        s - String [] to convert
        Returns:
        double [] containing a double representation of each String from the input array.

      • toFloatArray

        public static float[] toFloatArray(String[] s)
        This method is converting a String [] to a float [] of same length.
        Parameters:
        s - String [] to convert
        Returns:
        float [] containing a float representation of each String from the input array.

        public static int[] toIntArray(String[] s)
        This method is converting a String [] to a int [] of same length.
        Parameters:
        s - String [] to convert
        Returns:
        int [] containing a float representation of each String from the input array.

      • toLongArray

        public static long[] toLongArray(String[] s)
        This method is converting a String [] to a long [] of same length.
        Parameters:
        s - String [] to convert
        Returns:
        long [] containing a float representation of each String from the input array.

      • getReader

        public static Reader getReader(String source)
                        throws WrappingRuntimeException
        Returns a character reader based reader upon the source given by the name. Different sources such as web-servers or files will be choosen automatically determind by the given name, i.e., a source starting with http will be treated as a web-based text-file. At this time only http and files are supported.
        Parameters:
        source - name of the data source provided as reader
        Returns:
        the given source as reader
        Throws:
        WrappingRuntimeException - if an error of any type occures

      • changeSuffix

        public static String changeSuffix(String filename,
                                  String newSuffix)
        Assumes that the given String indicates a file and replaces the suffix by a new one. The suffix if given by "*.suffix" meaning the last found '.' and all following character will be replaced. If there's no '.' in the given String the given suffix will be concatenated.
        Parameters:
        filename - String treated as file name
        newSuffix - new suffix for the file name
        Returns:
        a String representing a file name

      • prunePath

        public static String prunePath(String filename)
        Assumes that the given String represents a fully qualified file name (i.e., with path information) and returns the file name without any folder information by pruning all parts before the last separator character return the file name itself
        Parameters:
        filename - fully qualified file name
        Returns:
        file name withiout path information
        See Also:
        File.separator
